channel.title: BBC News - Home

item.title: Budget 2021: Furlough set to be extended - Kwasi Kwarteng
item.description: Kwasi Kwarteng says help for firms and workers will continue, as Chancellor Rishi Sunak prepares to unveil the Budget.

item.title: Covid-19: Regular tests a 'game-changer' for schools, says science adviser
item.description: Rapid tests will give confidence that schools can open safely, a government science adviser says.

item.title: Covid Brazil variant 'may spread more easily'
item.description: The first detailed studies of the P.1 variant suggest it may be up to twice as transmissible.

item.title: Scottish government lawyers had 'reservations' about Salmond case
item.description: Concerns were raised about the legal battle more than two months before the government conceded the case.

item.title: Edward Colston statue: Four deny damage to statue
item.description: The four have appeared in court after Edward Colston's statue was torn down in Bristol.

item.title: Pontins used 'undesirables list' of Irish surnames
item.description: The holiday firm is to review working practices after using a list to screen out Gypsies and Travellers.

item.title: Twitch backtracks after outcry for using 'gender neutral' term 'womxn'
item.description: The streaming platform said it had changed its spelling of "women" to be more gender neutral.

item.title: Energy firms overcharged one million switching customers
item.description: Households were overcharged by a total of £7.2m when they should have been protected from price rises.

item.title: Liverpool legend Ian St John dies aged 82
item.description: Former Liverpool and Scotland forward Ian St John has died at the age of 82.

item.title: Nigeria school abduction: Hundreds of girls released by gunmen
item.description: A group of nearly 300 girls are released after they were abducted from their school last week.

item.title: Ant Middleton axed by C4 over 'personal conduct'
item.description: The broadcaster confirms he won't be taking part in future series of SAS: Who Dares Wins.

item.title: Angelina Jolie sells Winston Churchill painting for record £7m
item.description: The Tower Of The Koutoubia Mosque, owned by the actress, is sold to an unidentified buyer.

item.title: Human origins: 'Little Foot' fossil's big journey out of Africa
item.description: How the priceless skull of an ancient ancestor was brought to the UK from South Africa for study.

item.title: Timelapse of Indonesia volcano erupting
item.description: The volcano in North Sumatra's latest eruption sent ash up to 5km (3.1 miles) into the air.

item.title: Migrating flamingos turn Mumbai lakes into 'sea of pink'
item.description: Thousands of flamingos migrate to western India every year in search for food and nesting grounds.

item.title: The Papers: Digital travel passes and 'prayers for Philip'
item.description: Plans for a vaccine passport to boost travel and fears over Prince Philip's health are among the front-page stories.

item.title: The new voice of The Simpsons character Dr Julius Hibbert
item.description: Kevin Richardson is the first black actor to voice Dr Julius Hibbert on the television comedy.

item.title: Documenting emperor penguins in Antarctica
item.description: Stefan Christmann spent almost 15 months in Antarctica alongside 10,000 emperor penguins.

item.title: Back to school with a little bear and his hearing aids
item.description: How a picture book about a little bear who discovers he is deaf tells a personal story for its creators.

item.title: Palestinian 'Techno Queen' Sama' Abdulhadi faces court over shrine event
item.description: DJ Sama' Abdulhadi is facing a court hearing following a music event near a West Bank holy site.

item.title: Love Island: South Africa's reality show is 'too white'
item.description: Viewers are asking why most contestants in the reality show are white in the majority-black country.

item.title: Possible 'Banksy' artwork appears on Reading prison wall
item.description: The street art appears overnight on the side of Reading Prison which is under threat of development.

item.title: 'Undiscovered Titian painting' found in Ledbury church
item.description: An art historian claims to have found the Renaissance master's signature during restoration work.

item.title: The extraordinary rise and fall of trainer Gordon Elliott
item.description: Profile of Irish racehorse trainer Gordon Elliott, who faces an inquiry after being pictured sat on a dead horse.

item.title: Aston Martin: The billionaire building 'a British Ferrari'
item.description: Lawrence Stroll, executive chairman of Aston Martin, tells the BBC he wants to build a firm with a "luxury profile".

item.title: Fortnite: From piano player to pro gamer - aged just eight
item.description: Joseph Deen tells the BBC about his ambitions after signing with a professional esports team.

item.title: Covid-19: Can more mayors heal the 'North-South divide'?
item.description: Local leaders are pushing for more devolution, as England eases out of lockdown.

item.title: How rape allegations have rocked Australian politics
item.description: A political adviser's accusation has prompted other women to come forward with their own allegations.

item.title: 'Fake accounts used my pictures to sell sex'
item.description: Women tell BBC Scotland how scammers used their images on fake accounts advertising sex work websites.

item.title: Dozens of arts freelancers lose out on Covid support over tax 'error'
item.description: Dozens of arts freelancers miss out on Covid support because of errors with their pay, Equity says.

item.title: Syria war: 'This is the price we had to pay for freedom'
item.description: Syrian civilians describe the devastating impact 10 years of war has had on them.

item.title: Mercedes unveil Lewis Hamilton's 2021 Formula 1 car
item.description: Mercedes reveal Lewis Hamilton's car for the 2021 season that retains the team's black anti-racism livery for a second season.

item.title: Jockey apologises for video of him climbing on dead horse
item.description: Amateur jockey Rob James apologises for a video of him climbing on to a dead horse at a training gallops.

item.title: PM Johnson backs potential UK and Republic of Ireland bid for 2030 World Cup
item.description: Prime Minister Boris Johnson says it is the "right time" to bid to host the 2030 World Cup and the plan is backed by football associations across the UK and the Republic of Ireland.

item.title: Is Fernandes' replacement at Sporting Lisbon Portugal's next superstar?
item.description: Sporting Lisbon appear to have struck gold with a former Wolves youngster who has a better scoring record than Bruno Fernandes.

item.title: Fulham midfielder Kevin McDonald to have kidney transplant
item.description: Fulham midfielder Kevin McDonald says he has chronic kidney disease and is due to have a transplant next month.

item.title: England opener Beaumont tops ODI batting rankings
item.description: England opener Tammy Beaumont becomes the leading one-day batter in the world for the first time.

item.title: Covid: Can I go on furlough and will it be extended?
item.description: The chancellor is being urged to extend the furlough scheme until summer at the earliest

item.title: Budget 2021: Five things to look out for from Rishi Sunak
item.description: Tax rises and an extension of Covid support are both tipped to be announced in this week’s Budget.

item.title: Budget 2021: What is it and when will it happen?
item.description: The Budget - when is it, what does it do and what should we expect to hear from the chancellor?

item.title: Budget 2021: 'Furlough is a lifeline, I hope they extend it'
item.description: More support for jobs is expected in Chancellor Rishi Sunak's Budget, but will it be enough?

item.title: Covid: Which areas are being mass tested for new variants?
item.description: The government hopes "surge" testing will reduce transmission of new variants of Covid-19.

item.title: Coronavirus: How much will it cost the UK and how will we pay?
item.description: The pandemic is costing the government hundreds of billions of pounds. Where will it all come from?

item.title: When does the stamp duty holiday in England and Northern Ireland end?
item.description: Stamp duty changes introduced to boost the housing market are due to end in March.

item.title: What are the Brazil, South Africa and UK variants and will vaccines work?
item.description: More cases are being found in the UK, including a variant first seen in Brazil.

item.title: Lockdown Learning: What educational resources are on TV, iPlayer and online?
item.description: As schools remain closed to most pupils, the BBC is offering a wealth of educational material.
